Two transitions (159.7 IT and 215.5 keV after beta-
decay in As-77) were used to define c-s average for
7 runs.
Using 1/v law for cold and thermal neutrons,the thermal
capture cross-section for germanium at v=2200 m/s was
obtained by thermal cross-section of gold.
For self-absorption - correction factors 0.999 for Ge
target, 0.978 for gold foil.
Contribution from the target inhomogeneity was
estimated from the mass inhomogeneity folded by
the beam distribution.
For gamma-ray attenuation - 0.936 and 0.953 values for
159.7 keV and 215.5 keV, respectively.
Of authors. Total uncertainty can be reduced from 16 mb
to 11 mb under assumption, that emission probabilities
of Ge-77m are independent of each other.

Thermal neutron cross-section to the ground state was
based on two transitions 367.4 kev and 558.0 keV.
C-S is fed by IT from shorter-lived isomeric state.
Using 1/v law for cold and thermal neutrons,the thermal
capture cross-section for germanium at v=2200 m/s was
obtained by thermal cross-section of gold.
For self-absorption - correction factors 0.999 for Ge
target, 0.978 for gold foil.
Contribution from the target inhomogeneity was
estimated from the mass inhomogeneity folded by
the beam distribution.
Of authors. Using the transitions with lower
gamma-energies at 211.0 keV and 215.5 keV to derive
cross-section leads to lower values 57.9+-3.3 mb and
58.5+-3.3 mb, respectively. While 714.4 keV transition
yields to 69.4+-3.8 mb and 1193.3 keV transition
yields to 66.7+-4.3 mb in agreement with results,
obtained by 367.4 and 558.0 keV transitions,
one has to conclude, that emission probabilities
given for two low-lying energies in REL-REF of
Farhan+ are too high.
Half-life error 0.01 hr, intensity errors 0.003 and
0.004, respectively.

Tables 5, 6 of reference J,EPJ/A,40,61.
Energy calibration, corrected for nonlinearity was
achieved using the numerous background peaks of 19F in
the spectrum of the empty target. The detection
efficiency calibration was performed by utilizing the
decay radiation of 60Co, 133Ba, 152Eu sources placed at
the target position and prompt gamma rays produced by
neutron irradiation of N, Cl and Cr.
Transitions in the germanium isotopes were identified
by comparing the spectra of the enriched, the depleted
and the empty targets taken in the singles mode.
If a peak in the depleted spectrum was identified to
be due to neutron capture on 73Ge or on 74Ge, the
corresponding contribution in the enriched spectrum can
be subtracted from overlapping peaks in the enriched
spectrum.
The relative intensities in 77Ge were normalized to the
strongest transition of 5911.33 keV.
Unless otherwise noted in table A.1, a transition was
placed in the level scheme only if the complete path
from the capture state to the ground state or to the
isomeric state could be reconstructed with 90% CL.
If a coincidence for a transition was observed, that is
not part of an established decay path, the energy of
the coincident photon is shown in the misc column.
Of authors.
-The intensities of the delayed gamma rays were
remeasured using the same facility and the same samples
as for the experiments with prompt radiation for a
detailed reanalysis.

To establish the decay scheme, gamma-gamma
coincidences were measured using both Ge detectors in
coincidence mode.
Coincident transition
Isotopically enriched GeO2 target of mass 580.1 mg.
Second sample of 435.7mg of GeO2 powder depleted in
76Ge - to identify peaks resulting from neutron capture
by 74Ge.
Isotopic abundances of the samples in percent:
Enriched: sum of 70Ge, 72Ge, 73Ge - 0.3, 74Ge - 12.7,
GeO2 powder was sealed in a FEP (Fluorinated
Ethylene-Propylene) bag. An empty target consisting
only of the FEP bag (70mg) was irradiated for
background determination.
All targets were exposed for about 15 h,
for the depleted target a lower neutron flux than for
the others.
After the activation, a waiting time of 20 min (5 min)
for the enriched (depleted) target. The decay spectra
of the enriched (depleted) targets were recorded with
the same standard data acquisition (DAQ) equipment for
about 33 h (4 h).
Isotopically enriched target (304.1mg) taken from the
same batch was irradiated by a thermal equivalent
neutron flux 1.48*10**9 n/(cm2 s) for 8.26 d - in
coincidence measurement.
Table A.1 of J,EPJ/A,48,20,2012 .
Pill of GeO2 was irradiated together with a piece of
gold. Knowing their thickness and masses the
intensities of the prompt gamma rays in the Ge isotopes
could be related to the reference transition in gold at
247 keV, relying on a cross section of 5.56(8) b from
STI/PUB/1263(http://www-nds.iaea.org/pgaa/tecdoc.pdf).
Alternatively, the partial cross-sections were derived
from the decay peaks of 77Ge observed in the prompt
spectrum. Both approaches are in good agreement, i.e.
within 0.15% and 1.8% depending on the line used for
normalization.
Applying the obtained renormalization factor of
fr = 0.395(15) to the relative intensities given in
table A.1 (=Subent 005) the partial cross-sections can
be calculated. For 862 keV line -
